title.narrative: UNDP: Consolidate the democratic transition in Tunisia: Support to the Tunisian Parliament (phase II)

description.narrative: On 27 January 2014, Tunisia achieved a major milestone in its democratic transition when the National Constituent Assembly (NCA) adopted the country’s new constitution with the approval of 200 votes out of 216. This marks a significant achievement and reflects remarkable progress in developing a new political framework based on dialogue, compromise, and consensus building. The new constitution has been widely celebrated within Tunisia and beyond, as both reflecting the common vision of the diverse components of Tunisian society, and as a progressive and inclusive document that is underpinned through powerful commitments to human rights as well as a number of democratically innovative features. The new parliament has a central role in the governance system established by the constitution. Specifically, the parliament will be responsible for ensuring that the new constitutional framework is fully implemented. Given that the constitution was drafted from scratch and contains numerous provisions that will require both new legislative underpinning and institution building, the burden on parliament during the next phase of transition between 2015 and the next scheduled elections in 2019 will be substantial. Tunisia faces pressing citizen demands for a democratic dividend in terms of inclusive growth and poverty reduction. Strong and effective democratic institutions are required in order to assure enhanced human development and ultimately the sustainability of the democratic transition. In this regard, the proposed project is closely aligned with the Country Programme Document (2015-2019) and Country Programme Action Plan (CPAP) of UNDP Tunisia, developed in conjunction with the Tunisian government, and approved by UNDP’s Executive Board in June 2014. The commitment of UNDP to support strengthened planning on the part of Tunisian institutions is reflected in this document in its support to the development and implementation of a multi-year strategic development plan for t
